events.message: The applicant completed and submitted the personal loan application form online to request funds for upcoming medical expenses.
The loan application was categorised as a personal loan due to keywords such as medical expenses and personal debt mentioned by the applicant.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to review the application details and communicate further requirements with the applicant.
The loan officer conducted an initial assessment of the application, noting the applicant’s stable income but some existing personal debt.
Requested additional financial documents including recent pay stubs, medical bills, and credit statements to verify applicant’s situation.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documents showing proof of income, medical treatments, and current debts.
A credit check was performed revealing a good credit history with a few minor debts but no major delinquencies.
The risk assessment concluded that the applicant’s risk level is moderate with manageable debt-to-income ratio.
An offer detailing loan terms, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for their consideration.
The applicant responded positively to the offer and requested minor clarifications on repayment flexibility and fees.
The application was escalated to a senior loan officer to review requested clarifications and finalize terms.
Following review, the senior officer approved the personal loan with agreed-upon terms suitable for the applicant’s needs.
The loan amount was disbursed to the applicant’s bank account, enabling them to address their medical expenses promptly.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant is satisfied with the loan service and to offer support for repayment queries.
The loan application process was officially closed after confirming all conditions were met and the applicant acknowledged receipt of funds.
